title: " Beginner's Gardening Guide: Grow Your First Garden Like a Pro in Just 90 Seconds! "

subtasks: Determine gardening goals
Assess space characteristics
Choose appropriate plants
Collect essential gardening tools
Clear garden area
Loosen and improve soil
Decide garden type (in-ground, raised beds, containers)
Select planting method (seeds or seedlings)
Plant seeds or seedlings following instructions
Transplant seedlings after hardening off
Water plants consistently and properly
Apply mulch for moisture retention and weed control
Fertilize plants organically
Prune plants for growth and pest management
Harvest mature plants at the right time
Cut flowers in the morning
Determine gardening goals
Assess your space for sunlight, soil quality, and layout
Choose plants suitable for your climate and ease of growth
Collect essential gardening tools (trowel, hand fork, pruners, gloves, watering can)
Clear garden area of weeds and debris
Loosen soil and add organic matter
Decide on garden type (raised beds, in-ground, containers)
Select planting method (seeds or seedlings)
Plant seeds at proper depth and spacing
Harden seedlings before transplanting
Water plants gently upon planting and consistently thereafter
Apply mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds
Fertilize with organic options like compost or fish emulsion
Prune plants regularly for growth and manage pests with natural remedies
Harvest vegetables and herbs when mature
Cut flowers in the morning for freshness
